title: Addressing Misaligned Incentives (8 minute read)
content: Deb Liu discusses how misaligned incentives can cause problems within organizations. She suggests that to ensure successful outcomes, companies need to identify and correct any incentive structures that don't align with their overarching goals. By setting clear objectives and aligning incentives, organizations can foster an environment where teams are encouraged to work towards shared objectives rather than pursuing conflicting interests. She emphasizes that leaders must be proactive in recognizing and addressing such misalignments before they negatively impact the company's performance.

title: Alma’s Path To Product-Market Fit (10 minute read)

Ritter, being a non-technical founder, had to pivot multiple times to find product-market fit. His approach included performing meticulous customer research, engaging in numerous conversations, and adjusting his model based on feedback. He also leveraged his domain expertise in healthcare. Despite early setbacks, Ritter's persistence and adaptability eventually paid off, establishing Alma as a successful telehealth platform.

He also emphasizes the need for companies to continuously validate and refine their value proposition to stay competitive.

title: How to Hire Advisers (4 minute read)
content: This article digs into how to find good advisers, what to look for, and how to pay them.

title: The Freelancer’s Guide to Negotiating Higher Rates (4 minute read)
content: This article provides detailed advice on how to increase your rates as a freelancer, from researching industry standards to crafting a powerful value proposition to utilize when negotiating and building long-term relationships with clients.

title: Entrepreneurial Pitfalls, the Toxic Infatuation with Overwork (6 minute read)

title: Going Up-Market Will Not Solve Your Problems (3 minute read)

title: Web3 In SaaS Clothing (1 minute read)

title: Approaching Venture Capital with Intention w/ Seth Levine of Foundry (41 minute listen)

title: The Future Of Creator Commerce (8 minute read)
content: Rex Woodbury discusses how the rise of creator commerce is changing the way people shop. Creators are now able to sell their own products and services directly to their fans, bypassing traditional retailers. This is leading to a more personalized and engaging shopping experience for consumers.

title: To Build A Top Performing Team, Ask For 85% Effort (6 minute read)
content: Instead of asking for 100% effort from your team, ask for 85%. This will help your team members avoid burnout and be more productive. When team members are happy and productive, they are more likely to be creative and innovative. This can lead to better results for your team and your company.

title: Build a Running List of Interview Questions (1 minute read)
content: To best assess a candidate in the interview process, value-question alignment and a deep survey into the candidate's past should be conducted. Entrepreneurs should have a Google Doc or Notion of their favorite interview questions as a living doc for continuous improvement.

The startup’s success highlights the potential of entering niche tech markets. Kapila's advice to fellow entrepreneurs includes valuing learning, demonstrating competence, extending empathy, and spreading positivity, exemplifying how startup founders can foster growth and create impactful businesses.

title: ClientZen (Product)

title: Gong Engage (Product)
content: Gong Engage is an AI sales engagement solution powered by customer interactions.

title: Investing in Artists of a Company (5 minute read)
content: This article argues that investing in the artists of a company is a better way to invest than investing in the company itself. The reason is because artists are the ones who create the products and services that make a company successful. When artists are happy and productive, they are more likely to create great work. As a result, investing in artists can lead to higher returns for investors.

title: Test Your Startup Idea With AI: Must-Know Tips and Tools (7 minute read)

title: Mistral AI Raises $113M Seed Round (3 minute read)

The investment round, led by Lightspeed Venture Partners, valued Mistral AI at $260 million. Mistral AI plans to create models with a focus on transparency and utility using publicly available data and allow users to contribute their own datasets. It aims to release its first models for text-based generative AI in 2024.

title: Asking Questions Can Lead to Billion-Dollar Breakthroughs (4 minute read)

title: How to Do Great Work (28 minute read)

Curiosity and delight are powerful motivators, and surrounding yourself with the right people is important. Taking risks and protecting your morale are also key. Ultimately, anyone can try to do great work and make important discoveries.

title: Dell’s Capital Expertise (25 minute read)

It explores Dell's financial strategies, including efficient working capital management, asset monetization, and optimizing capital structure, which have allowed the company to thrive and remain competitive in the ever-changing tech industry.

title: What the European AI Act Means for You, AI Developer (11 minute read)
content: The EU AI Act is the world's first legislation on artificial intelligence, similar to GDPR but for AI. It introduces definitions for 'foundation models' and 'general-purpose AI systems' and sets out dos and don'ts for AI practices. The Act also focuses on trustworthy AI development and includes obligations for high-risk AI systems. The legislation is currently going through final negotiations before enforcement.

title: Are People In Tech In An AI Echo Chamber? (HN Thread)
content: Everyone in tech knows AI is revolutionary. But do people outside of tech feel the same? This Hacker News thread dives into that question and whether the AI hype has gotten out of hand.

title: Why Transformative AI Is Really, Really Hard To Achieve (21 minute read)
content: While humans have a good track record of innovation, the trend growth rate of GDP per capita has never exceeded three percent per year. There has yet to be a technology that breaks the three percent threshold. Only strong evidence should cause us to expect anything different. AI is likely transformative in the same way that the internet was, but it has many hurdles in the way to the accelerating growth rates predicted by some.

title: Building Prestige (6 minute read)

title: 5 Interesting Learnings From SEMRush (5 minute read)

title: How Markets Value Software Companies in 2023 (2 minute read)

title: VC Finds Its Footing As Headwinds Weaken (3 minute read)

title: What 70m Thread users Mean for B2B Marketers (2 minute read)

That, and there is a lot less money being spent on Twitter ads at the moment that needs to go somewhere.

title: What Ripple’s Partial XRP Win Means for Other Crypto Firms Fighting SEC (6 minute read)

Don’t think this will be a return to the heady days of limitless ICOs and unbounded heights for ridiculous NFT projects. Big banks and traditional finance companies are picking up the biggest wins and this Ripple win will likely be more in their favor than the lay person crypto hodler.

title: Early interviews for AI companies - apply by Tuesday July 18, 2023 (4 minute read)
content: YC, as shrewd as ever, is doing interviews in earnest this summer for a few open slots in their YC W24 batch. Things are moving so fast in AI it almost feels like it’s a glacial process for January 2024 inclusion but get in there and apply if you’ve got something special!

title: Relationship Building (2 minute read)
content: A good reminder from David Cummings about the importance of building and maintaining relationships. I had a random friend from High School reach out this weekend telling me he was hosting a get together in town. Jumping at the chance to see real humans is one thing, meeting several random connections with valuable connectedness I didn’t realize would happen was just a bonus. These personal connections will be King/Queen in a post-AI world.

title: Dear SaaStr: Who Should Approve Startup CEO Expenses? (3 minute read)
content: Just because you’re the CEO doesn’t mean you get to dictate your salary or even arbitrary expenses. I remember hassling over my first salary in a venture-backed company and realizing you don’t just get to make it up. Transparency with your investors builds trust.

content: Seodity is an all-in-one AI SEO tool.

content: Cash-strapped tech start-ups are exploring sales to bigger companies in order to survive a funding crunch.

title: Advertisers to Zuck: Take Our Money, Put Ads On Threads (7 minute read)
content: We said it last week but there is a massive opportunity with Threads. The Zuck has a chance to redeem himself in the eyes of the world and with the successful launch of Threads, he’s poised to catapult Meta even further. If you’re making money on Twitter tools right now, it’s time to retool to Threads and maximize. You won’t regret it.

title: LinkedIn’s Product Evolution And The Art Of Building Complex Systems (65 minute listen)
content: An interview with Hari Srinivasan, VP of Product at LinkedIn, on LinkedIn’s unique business model, strategies for building and maintaining complex systems, and how to adapt to a skill-first talent market.

title: Neobank consolidation begins to pick up (2 minute read)
content: On Monday we flagged that cash-strapped tech startups are exploring sales to bigger companies in order to survive a funding crunch. Well, in fintech, it’s M&A, M&A everywhere. Neobanks are merging with one another to bolster their market share and legacy players are mopping up startups to expand their product offering and reach new customer segments.

title: Uber faces lawsuit demanding coverage of UberEats Drivers’ work expenses (2 minute read)
content: Uber Technologies Inc may face a lawsuit in California regarding the coverage of work-related expenses for drivers. If successful, what precedent does this set for the broader gig economy?

title: Global fintech investments falls over H1 2023 amid economic turbulence but sector remains resilient (2 minute read)
content: $27.3 billion has been deployed across 1,714 fintech venture deals in H1 2023. Down 14% since H2 2022.

title: Why consumer subscriptions are so hard and what to do about it (8 minute read)
content: Retaining existing customers is important in the current market. Consumers are irrational. It’s incredibly dififcult to predict who will churn and it’s hard (and expensive) to win their attention in the first place these days. Casey Winters double-clicks on a few tactics and strategies to ensure you’re not leaving money on the table.

title: When to Dig a Moat (11 minute read)
content: Generative AI has caused a bit of a divide on the topic of moats. Now that we can build things quickly, and often without deep engineering expertise, are we seeing the erosion of defensible moats? Packy explores the types of moats that might exist beyond the technical product.

title: Cracking the code to hypergrowth: 5 strategies from Vanta’s CEO and Founder (4 minute read)
content: The central theme? You guessed it, customer centricity. Listen to your customers, build a product that truly serves their needs, and acknowledge that your product likely needs to evolve as their needs change, particularly if you’re building for startups that grow up one day.

title: Llama 2 - Meta AI (Product)
content: AI continues to move at breakneck speed. Meta is pushing forward with the latest iteration of their Llama open source model trained on 2 trillion tokens.

title: Reforge Artifacts (2 minute read)
content: Reforge just launched Artifacts - a library of documents capturing lessons and insights from established founders and operators.

title: Wope (Product)
content: SEO meets AI, helping you better understand the competitive landscape in a post-generative-AI world.

title: How ICs can get recognition for their work on big projects (27 minute audio)
content: An interview with Dr. Cat Hicks, Director of Pluralsight Flow’s Developer Success Lab, where they double-click on how to ensure good work is seen in larger organizations.

title: Companies requiring employees to be full-time in-office are struggling to recruit new talent (5 minute read)
content: There seems to be an inverse correlation between the number of mandated days in the office and a company's ability to attract and retain talent. Less flexibility causes churn - who’d have thought?

title: Zack Schildhorn, Founder of Series Z, gives advice on developing a successful pitch for investors (34 minute audio)
content: Khosla Ventures just dropped a collection of recordings from their CEO Summit in May 2023. In this recording, Zach talks about how successful fundraising is all about provoking genuine human emotions through storytelling.

title: Space tech funding comes back to earth (3 minute read)
content: Less venture funding dollars are going to space tech startups. In 2021, $12.1 billion went to space tech across 450 deals. In 2022, this decreased by 25% to $9 billion. So far in 2023, we’ve only seen $2.4 billion go to them. To the moon, maybe, maybe not.

title: Michael Moritz closes a long chapter at Sequoia Capital, and four other partners depart the firm (7 minute read)
content: Five partners are leaving the firm, but the headline is that Mike Moritz is officially moving on after 38 years service. As the venture capital scene gets more competitive, it’ll be interesting to see what 2024 and beyond has in store for Sequoia.

title: ChatGPT's performance is slipping, apparently (4 minute read)
content: UC Berkeley researchers found that ChatGPT has not improved over time, and in fact, may have gotten worse. The researchers suggest that one of the reasons for this decline could be the result of new safety protocols being implemented by OpenAI.

title: Your guide to SaaS product metrics (8 minute read)
content: This article explores the metrics you should be aware of as you build out your product-led growth muscle at your SaaS company. It double-clicks on the funnel conversions you can expect from when a visitor lands on your website and eventually becomes a paying customer.

title: Building an an Early Stage Startup: Lessons from Akita Software (11 minute read)
content: Gergely, writer at The Pragmatic Engineer, interviews Jean Yang, the founder of Akita, which was very recently acquired by Postman. They dive into finding your co-founder, fundraising, hiring, pivoting, and all the challenges faced along the way.

title: Effective > Productive (1 minute read)
content: Optimizing for productivity and being busy doesn’t necessarily mean you’re working on the right things.

title: Microsoft and Meta expand their AI partnership with Llama 2 on Azure and Windows (Product)
content: MSFT is on a tear as of late and they are playing every angle they can. Llama 2 was just announced and Microsoft is going to be offering it up on Azure and Windows. If you’re an early-stage company on Azure you get the best of all worlds.

title: SaaS Boilerplate (Product)
content: This keeps coming across my feed and given we’re in the post-AI era, being able to spin up a SaaS backend quickly and customize your  AI-tools du jour is no joke.

title: GitHub Copilot Chat beta now available for every organization (Product)
content: Putting the power of GPT-4 into the hands of developers at a conversational level is going to be yet another game changer. AI continues to move at the pace of … well … AI.

title: a16z - the neverending game: how AI will create a new category of games (20 minute read)
content: AI has long played a role in games, from procedurally generated environments, to machine learning and NPC behavior. Generative AI is the next frontier in game development, enabling hyper personalization and adaptive environments. How about a game that designs itself and never ends?

title: Rich and Anonymous (5 minute read)
content: An insightful read that digs into the positive correlation between wealth and social liability. In today’s society, the wealthier you get, the more you feel a responsibility to give back to family, friends, and the global community.

title: Find Your Winning Idea By Selling Products That Don’t Exist Yet (7 minute read)
content: The story of Material Security’s path to product-market fit, in which they took a circuitous route where they tested multiple different ideas.

title: Twitter’s brand might soon be taking flight (2 minute read)
content: Elon says he’s looking to change Twitter’s logo, tweeting, “And soon we shall bid adieu to the Twitter brand and, gradually, all the birds”. He likes the letter “X”, apparently.

title: Block Sues Visa and Mastercard Over Interchange Fees (1 minute read)

title: McKinsey weighs in on GenAI through a collaboration with Cohere (4 minute read)

title: Want To Steal a Customer from the Competition? You Gotta Do The Work (2 minute read)

title: Accelerate The Growth of Your Subscription Business with Usage Based Pricing (7 minute read)

Consumers and businesses are getting used to this model although it is always a balancing act of too-much-too-early. This article covers several tactics to use when exploring the usage-based model in conjunction with subscription pricing.

title: Copy what’s popular and differentiate where it matters (13 minute read)
content: The web is increasingly becoming less text heavy and more visual. Furniture in your Airbnb looks the same and iconic brand logos are starting to look similar. What’s happening? Paras argues that conformity in core domains brings trust, and all founders should be thinking about this for their startups.

title: A library of reading materials for the wannabe angel investor (Airtable Database)
content: Angel investing as a founder can be a great way to embed yourself more deeply into the startup ecosystem, build a network, and acquire knowledge that might help you tackle your own startup challenges.

title: Wix announces a new AI site generator (2 minute video)

title: 93% of You Say Competitors Lie To Close Deals. You’ve Gotta At Least Get Good at Counter-FUD (5 minute read)

title: What to watch in AI (30 minute read)

title: Paving the Path for “Blue-Collar AI” Professionals (5 minute read)
content: AI might be closing the doors for a few workers, but it could open some for others. Myra Roldan explores what blue collar work 2.0 might look like in the age of AI, from AI Farmhands to Warehouse Operators.

title: State of Fintech Q2 2023 (4 minute read)
content: Here are the key takeaways from CB Insights latest report, which explores the state of global fintech. Global funding falls, LatAm and the Caribbean funding doubles, all five of the quarters IPOs come from fintechs based outside of the US.

title: The Pilgrims Raised 4 Rounds of Funding (2 minute read)
content: If you don’t know your near-term history about technology over the last 50 years, you really should dig in. History always repeats itself and we’re headed into another massive boom cycle. What lessons can you take from the past to apply today? Can you read the tea leaves?

title: Twitter in hot water with the “X” rebrand (1 minute read)
content: The US has over 900 trademarks for the letter “X”, including those held by Microsoft and Meta. Bold move Elon, let’s see how this one plays out.

title: The 3-person Unicorn Startup (6 minute read)
content: The countdown is on and the signs are already there: the first 3 person company with $100M+ in revenue has already been founded and is on its way to unicorn status. I cannot imagine building a non-AI-powered company ever again.

title: What happens when tasks fall outside of your organizational structure? (4 minute read)
content: No matter how well you lay out your organizational structure and processes, there’ll be many tasks and events that don’t fit well. It will be unclear who is responsible for handling it or how it should be handled. In this article, Sean Byrnes gives some insight on a few tactics to handle these outlier tasks.

title: R&D is the key to unlocking free-cash-flow in SaaS (6 min read)
content: Single product software eventually reaches market saturation, hitting the top of the s-curve and causing growth to slowly grind to a halt. The antidote is continuous investment in research and development, facilitating an evolution into multi-product greatness.

title: 20 Ways Tech Leaders And Teams Can Make The Most Of Summer Slowdowns (7 minute read)
content: I love the notion of a Summer slowdown in startups. Of course, if you’re fundraising, or all of your buyers are on holiday, things can slow down. But ultimately, there’s still an endless laundry list of work to be done. As a founder, you want to continue momentum towards these goals, but think about how your team is taking the time to pause, reflect, and reset over Summer.

title: What got you here isn’t getting you there (12 minute read)
content: An insightful chat with Art Levy, CSO for Brex, on the ups-and-downs of leading a company, and more importantly, about how you have to keep hacking/evolving your offerings if you expect your company to grow.

title: 12 tips for networking as an introvert (5 minute read)
content: There’s this divide in startups. Some advocate strongly for networking events and connecting with people in general. Others focus on ruthlessly building your product, seeing networking events as a waste of time. There’s likely some truth in both sides of the argument. Not all networking events are equal. If you do decide to go, here’s some thoughts on how to show up effectively.

title: ChatGPT just launched their Android app (1 minute read)
content: OpenAI’s ChatGPT is now available in the Google Play store for Android devices. Now you can ask your fundamental business questions on the go.

title: Don’t get addicted to fantasy economics (6 minute read)
content: We’re all talking about how the era of growth at all costs is over. Startups can no longer build a strategy around using VC funding to subsidize a service in order to acquire market share and later figure out how to monetise effectively. But, what if this play looked a bit less like Uber and Doordash, and more like OpenAI? Would it be sensible for a model to subsidize their service in order to optimize their access to training data in order to outpace competition through product refinement?

title: How Shopify builds product (12 minute read)
content: Lenny sits down with Glen Coates, VP of Product at Shopify, to understand how they’re still growing fast and shipping products at an impressively startuppy rate, despite being 17 years old and nearly 10,000 employees deep.

title: Start new employees in the deep end (2 minute read)
content: Hiring is a gamble - you never really know what a new employee is capable of. As a founder, your role is to test the boundaries of their capabilities, and the way to do that is to put them up to bigger and bigger tasks that encourage them to be their best. Take more chances with your new hires.

title: Everything is Cyclical (5 minute read)
content: In the dog days of Summer, you can’t help but take stock of things and look back. History has a way of repeating itself and everything is cyclical. We’re in another rerun of a disruptive tech cycle. Now is your chance to maximize.

title: Fed lifts rates, Powell leaves door open to another hike in September (4 minute read)
content: We’d be remiss if we didn’t bring your attention to the latest rate hike, and more importantly, the specter of future increases. Some say we’re bouncing off this recession, with markets still hot and inflation not cooling. All of these factors affect your company’s ability to scale and raise money.

title: Sequoia’s pulling back on crypto (2 minute read)
content: Sequoia Capital has cut the size of its cryptocurrency fund by more than 65%, from $585 million to $200 million. Talk about a pivot. We assume this is all going into AI, right?

title: My Favorite Interview Question (3 minute read)
content: I like to ask my team if the person they are recommending to hire would pass the “airport test” - if you were stuck in an airport for the next 8 hours, would you be psyched to chat with this person? I like Matt Blumberg’s approach as well though.

title: Raising Capital in H2 2023: What You Really Need To Know with Creandum Partner Peter Specht (7 minute read)
content: It isn’t the heady days of 2021 (“shut up and take my money!”), but there are glimmers of hope out there. This exhaustive review of current data on each stage of investing is a must read if you’re headed out to raise this Fall.

title: Raising Prices For Your Product: Should You Do It? If So, How? (6 minute read)
content: With just about every major SaaS provider raising their prices, should you take the plunge? Quick read on the things you’ll want to think through before doing so, as well as tips on how to test and roll it out.

title: From five to 50: How to hire at your early-stage startup (5 minute read)
content: It never hurts to study up on early-stage hiring especially in a post-AI, post-pandemic world. This is a great read that breaks down the 5-to-50 hiring tricks of the trade.

title: Pricing plans of 50 bottom up SaaS companies (Airtable database)
content: If you’re thinking about how to price for your SaaS startup, looking around at other examples in the market can be helpful. Here’s an Airtable database categorizing 50 different SaaS pricing plans.

title: Building a second brain using AI (7 minute read)
content: I’m an active Notion user, largely for curating interesting reads, infographics, and thoughts. In this article, Azeem Azhar unpacks how you can use AI to level up your research skills and turn Notion into a valuable database where you can store knowledge and more easily spot thematic connections and patterns.

title: a16z explores whether AI will unlock personal finance management (4 minute read)
content: We’re increasingly seeing more people want to take control of their finances. Fees charged by financial advisors, funds, and wealth managers, and valuable leaps in money tech, are encouraging people to go it alone when it comes to personal finance. Is there an opportunity for AI to take the wheel on this trend?

title: New Research on Embracing and Inspiring the Gen Z Workforce (4 min read)
content: Not all workers are created equal and your approach to Gen Z could be benefited by reviewing the recap of this Deloitte research.

title: Dear SaaStr: What Happens To Employees When a Company Gets Acquired? (2 minute read)
content: You never know, but the formula is pretty clear if/when you get acquired. Jason from SaaStr walks us through what to expect.

title: Signs We’ve Touched The Bottom (3 minute read)
content: Tomasz Tonguz believes we’ve hit the bottom for cloud revenue as the demand for AI is stabilizing infrastructure spend.

title: The Most Valuable Tech Companies Still Aren’t Buying Startups (3 minute read)
content: 2023 is on pace to have the smallest number of acquisitions by the Big Five (Apple, Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and Nvidia) in years, with these companies making just five known startup acquisitions so far.

title: The Second Half Of 2024 Could Be Really Good For SaaS (3 minute read)
content: Things are looking up for SaaS companies, so much so that Jason Lemkin believes a flood of strong SaaS IPOs are on the way for the second half of 2024.

title: How To Build A Successful Consumer Subscription Business (8 minute read)
content: An exploration into how to overcome the systemic challenges of B2C subscriptions and build a strong business.

title: Latest benchmarks on the journey from Seed to Series A in Europe (2 minute read)
content: Non-founders love setting benchmarks for founders. If you’re a European founder, or simply curious about the ecosystem, this article breaks down the average amounts raised before Series A and the ideal time frames between each successive raise.

title: How to measure and improve developer productivity (1h16m listen)
content: The average developer spends 17 hours per week on maintenance issues like debugging and refactoring. What happens when you reduce that time down significantly, enabling them to allocate more time to building the product? How much new opportunity and revenue could that time unlock?

title: Bleakers (Product)
content: Bleakers is a single entry space for product development.

title: Supademo (Product)
content: Communicating how products work is critical but it’s done inefficiently. Supademo makes this process easier by helping anyone create intuitive click-through demos.

title: AI Logo Art (Product)
content: AI logo art transforms your logos into stunning art with AI.

title: The Paradox Of AI And Data Roles (2 minute read)
content: Tomasz Tunguz explains why even though AI will automate some data work, it will also demand much more from data teams.

title: The strength of weak ties (7 minute read)
content: In 1973, Stanford sociologist Mark Granovetter showed just how important casual acquaintances are. 50 years on, this article is still a nice refresher on the power of maintaining your network beyond close friends and family.

title: Being in Command rather than in Control (5 minute read)
content: As a high growth founder, if you feel like you’re in control, you’re likely not moving fast enough. Being in command is a different dynamic. Command means you know what to measure and what you need to do, and although it might not all be progressing in the right direction, you have a grasp.

title: What the New Relic Sale Means for SaaS (2 minute read)
content: PE moves at this scale mean liquidity and potential opportunities for the mid-tier of companies. Since the big players aren’t buying right now, this is a great path to exit for a lot of these companies and 2023 is looking to be a banner year.

title: UK Gov and Singapore enhance cooperation (5 minute read)
content: The UK and Singaporean governments met to talk about CBDCs, international standards, and the ties between biodiversity and finance.

title: The Merge Blueprint (12 minute read)
content: A breakdown of how Merge, an API company, is using AI to speed up their team’s velocity.

title: Growth Tactics with Hypergrowth Partners Co-Founder Guillaume Cabane (5 minute read)
content: Optimize your outbound strategy. Use marketing tech. Build a growth team after you’ve achieved product market fit. Develop a growth mindset and experiment with new things at a high velocity.

title: Top metrics for vertical SaaS companies (16 minute read)
content: Horizontal SaaS has dominated headlines for the past several years. You build a product that’s industry agnostic but problem focused. Vertical SaaS is all about creating software for a very specific industry. This long read unpacks the key metrics and benchmarks you should be paying attention to if you’re building a vertical SaaS company.

title: Creating The Perfect Culture For Success: 9 Key Ingredients You Need To Know (6 minute read)
content: Individualism is on the rise in the workplace. Being able to balance individual identity with collective action is the key to providing an optimal employee experience and driving productivity.

title: Managing distractions (3 minute read)
content: Focus is a limited resource, and how we spend it is the foundation of any strategy we pursue. Trying to do everything all at once almost always leads to doing nothing.

title: Winning the embedded fintech race is all about distribution (6 minute read)
content: In this article, Matt Brown unpacks how embedded fintech is a positive sum game for those involved in the value chain. However, there are three constraining factors and tradeoffs you need to consider when it comes to distribution: optimizing for unit economics, ease of ownership, and acceptance rate.

title: Servant leader, not order taker (2 minute read)
content: Successful leadership is about creating the conditions for success.

title: AI + Carbon = Funded Startup (4 minute read)
content: AI and carbon removal are two of the hottest trends in tech right now. Startups that combine the two have raised more than $400M in the last two years, with carbon tracking software an especially popular focus.

title: Where Will AI Have The Biggest Impact? Healthcare (5 minute read)
content: Healthcare is 20% of the US economy, but the industry has been slow to adopt technology. With AI, healthtech companies no longer need to fight the uphill battle of training people on software. Instead, they can sell AI that acts like a person and takes more and more of the work off healthcare professionals’ plates, enabling them to work on more interesting problems and practice at the top of their licenses.

title: Apple Card’s savings account reaches $10B in deposits (3 minute read)
content: Apple launched a savings account in partnership with Goldman in April 2023, and it’s already reached $10B in deposits. This showcases the power of brand trust, distribution, and ease-of-use in gaining critical mass with new ventures.

title: What Does Great Look Like In A Chief People Officer? (3 minute read)
content: Three great tips from serial entrepreneur Matt Blumberg about what you should look for in a great people officer.

title: Guide to all the incoming top tech conferences (6 minute read)
content: Planning a tech conference roadshow? Here’s your list of all the major tech conferences coming up across the US and Europe.

title: Managing your priorities and energy (11 minute read)
content: “Company, Team, Self” is a useful decision-making framework. However, the glue that binds all of this into outcomes is energy. By over-relying on this framework, you often neglect yourself or focus on things that don’t give you energy as a founder or operator. This has a finite runway - you'll eventually have to factor in doing things that give you energy to ensure you can keep on doing things sustainably.

title: Freepik Image Generator (Product)
content: Freepik allows you to generate your own unique AI images directly in Figma.

title: Vizly (Product)
content: Vizly uses AI to analyze your data in seconds.

title: Reflex (Product)
content: Reflex enables you to build web apps in pure Python and deploy them with a single command.

title: WTF Happened In 2023? (12 minute read)
content: With recent advancements in AI, superconductors, nuclear energy, and infrastructure, 2023 will likely be looked back on as the year that technological progress really began taking off again.

title: The Future of Longevity: Keeping Healthy People Healthy (9 minute read)
content: The real opportunity in healthcare is not just curing those that are ill - it’s about keeping healthy people healthy for longer. This thoughtful piece about the opportunity for TechBio founders to prevent rather than treat is a long but fantastic one.

title: Cultivating A State Of Mind Where New Ideas Are Born (17 minute read)
content: Many founders in the early 2010s thought that working within a thriving social scene of peers would help them percolate ideas as they built their startup, but there are no famous success stories from people who tried. Working in solitude allows for serious work to be done. Being in an environment where the opinions of others matter can kill ideas quickly. This essay analyzes the working notes of several highly creative individuals to distill different approaches to developing a creative state.

title: Uber records profit for the first time ever (1 minute read)
content: Does this make up for the $25bn in funding Uber received from venture investors?

title: Why Defense Tech Is Becoming The Next Big Thing For Investors (5 minute read)
content: Dan Gwak of Point72 Ventures explains why the Ukraine war has precipitated a renewed interest in defense tech from both founders and investors.

title: Higher Funding Doesn’t Mean Faster Hiring In Startups (2 minute read)
content: Despite popular opinion, just because a startup has raised a lot of money, doesn’t mean that the startup will significantly raise headcount. More companies are now able to scale revenue without needing to raise headcount because of AI or product-led growth.

title: Building a compensation system at your startups (20 minute read)
content: If you’re at 30+ employees, you should really start to think about implementing a compensation strategy. Bands, titles, and remuneration can get complicated very quickly. This guide walks through how to keep it simple and future-proof.

title: Bring a simple structure to your meetings (2 minute read)
content: A 5 minute silent read of a document at the beginning of the meeting is optimal to get everyone on the same page. Then, ensure you have a leader guiding the remainder of the conversion.

title: 5 Top Tips to Dive Down Churn in The Early Days (2 minute read)
content: It all comes down to customer centricity. Find out who your top customers are and simply spend time with them.

title: Cake Equity (Product)
content: Cake Equity makes issuing best-practice equity plans easy.

title: SlideSpeak (Product)
content: SlideSpeak uses AI to generate summaries, answer questions, and get action items out of any PowerPoint presentation.

title: Layman Law (Product)
content: Layman Law simplifies legal language so you don’t have to spend thousands on legal fees.

title: Startup Identity & The Sadness Of A Successful Exit (9 minute read)
content: Many founders experience sadness after selling their company as they are so obsessed with the startup that “founder” becomes a large part of their identity. However, it is important to know when the right time to fold is, and a successful exit is often worth the temporary sadness.

title: An investor’s perspective on why regular check-ins with portfolio companies are valuable (3 minute read)
content: As a founder, keeping your investors updated on progress via informal chats, a monthly email, and the odd WhatsApp is a great way to keep them close and better enable them to support you.

title: Great Time to Start a Company, Tough Time to Be Running One (3 minute read)
content: We’re not out of the woods yet in the macro climate, but the current environment looks great (albeit tough) to start a company. The talent pool is better than it has been in years, and things are looking brighter at the pre-seed and seed level.

title: Roundup of Generative AI in Big Tech (10 minute read)
content: An awesome roundup covering what the big tech companies are up to in Generative AI based on some of the discussions in their earnings calls for Q2. The reaction from big tech to AI has been swift, demonstrating the near-term importance of capitalizing on this opportunity.

title: State of Private Markets in Q2 2023 (13 minute read)
content: Carta dropped some insights on the current private landscape in its latest market deep-dive. Although fundraising rounds are on the up since Q1, it’s still 58% lower YoY. In terms of both deal count and cash raised, this was the slowest Q2 since 2018.

title: Is B2C and B2B Growth... the same? (8 minute read)
content: Now that you mention it, B2B startups are putting considerably more effort into their brand. Elena Verna explores how this trend towards B2B consumerization is all about the rising power of the end user in the buying journey.

title: 14 Tips on How to Sell to Private Equity and Venture Capital Funds (7 minute read)
content: This article offers tactics for companies looking to sell to private equity, VCs, and family offices. Tips include: investing in funds to earn evangelization, hosting target-focused roundtables or dinners to maximize engagement, and connecting funds with promising startups to highlight expertise. Engaging where investors congregate online, aligning with industry associations, leveraging targeted ads, and simplifying pricing models are also recommended.

title: You’re making it too hard for prospects to buy your product (15 minute read)
content: Speed and minimal friction are key to increasing conversion signups for your SaaS product. Product-led sales are all about having simple identification triggers that suggest a potential user has a higher likelihood of buying more from you and then strategically engaging your sales team.

title: There’s levels to this B2B sales game (10 minute read)
content: This post unpacks the 5 types of needs expressed by B2B customers. Try to cover off each of these in your sales and marketing process and see how it impacts the success of your sales.

title: YC Idea Matcher (Product)
content: Submit your idea and get a list of similar ideas that YCombinator has invested in before.

title: Metaphor (Product)
content: Metaphor Search’s API allows you to search the internet with AI.

title: Humanscript (GitHub Repo)
content: Humanscript is a script interpreter that infers the meaning behind commands written in natural language using large language models.

title: Pleo's PLG Journey with Haresh Bajaj, VP Product Growth (13 minute read)
content: Akash Bajwa double-clicks on Pleo’s product-led growth model. Pleo is a Denmark-based fintech valued at $4.7bn in 2021. In this interview, Pleo’s VP of Product Growth shares insights on the tools they use, playbooks, and user signals they watch out for before they engage their sales team.

title: How the most successful B2B startups came up with their original idea (30 minute read)
content: This is the first in a seven-part series that dives into how to build and scale a successful B2B business, based on interviews and learnings from dozens of today’s most successful B2B founders.

title: Avoiding imaginary constraints (3 minute read)
content: Sometimes constraints are real, like laws or genuine capital constraints. Sometimes they exist purely in our heads. When faced with a constraint, ask yourself: is this something you believe, or something you know?

title: SoftBank posts a loss (2 minute read)
content: SoftBank tallies up its numbers, which show a cumulative loss of $6.3B in its Vision Fund business.

title: Block shuts European P2P payments brand Verse (1 minute read)
content: Block is shutting down the Cash App's Verse brand in the EU and its BNPL platform Clearpay in Spain, France, and Italy to invest into other areas.

title: Surprising Data Points About the Venture Capital Market (2 minute read)
content: Tomasz slices-and-dices his thoughts on the Carta report on funding outlook based on data from the last few quarters. It contains some good news and some bad news. Must read for sure.

title: How to turn a promising start-up into a tech giant (30 minute listen)
content: Former Google and Stripe executive Claire Johnson tells the inside story of how the two companies went from promising tech start-ups to big businesses and how it was often chaos behind-the-scenes.

title: 5 Interesting Learnings from Atlassian at $3.2 Billion in ARR (2 minute read)
content: Atlassian has been focusing on upsells to its existing user base, acquiring large new logos, and improving operational efficiencies by hiring slower and reducing non-discretionary spending.

title: Pinecone’s journey from seed to 10,000 sign-ups per day (9 minute read)
content: We’ve posted a lot about product-led growth (PLG) lately. This is another great example of a company nailing PLG. The key takeaways include being really thoughtful about who you’re building the product for, focusing on a defined persona, and then making their pathway to try your product as frictionless as possible. The traditional B2B marketing playbook didn’t land for Pinecone’s product.

title: Recast (Product)
content: Recast turns your want-to-read articles into rich audio summaries.

title: Threado (Product)
content: Threado provides instant customer support in Slack and Discord.

title: Raizer (Product)
content: Raizer is a database of 51,000+ investors for your startup.

title: The Future of Technology Looks a Lot Like...Pixar? (13 minute read)
content: Pixar changed the animation game in movies. Generative AI tools are changing it once again by supercharging what everyday people can do with animations. What will be interesting to see is how IP owners license out content in a world of AI-powered creation.

title: Practice makes perfect (2 minute read)
content: Oftentimes people who appear like a natural at something have simply spent a lot of time getting it wrong. Whether you’re pitching to investors, recruiting, or convincing your partner why this new startup idea is worth leaving your job, it all comes down to practicing how you deliver the message.

title: A few stories about big decisions (5 minute read)
content: It is infinitely easier to build a narrative around things in retrospect, but it’s fascinating how seemingly small decisions can have profound long-term consequences. These short stories are a nice reminder that there’s still an emotional human behind all the data and insights.

title: The right to pay anonymously has become part of an EU culture war (3 minute read)
content: There’s a growing movement across the EU to save cash as governments, banks, and merchants encourage consumers to go digital.

title: Uber, Nvidia-backed delivery robot startup Serve Robotics to go public (3 minute read)
content: Serve Robotics, an autonomous sidewalk delivery robot startup that spun out of Uber’s acquisition of Postmates, is going public via a reverse merger with a blank-check company.

title: AI.com flips from ChatGPT to Elon Musk’s x.AI (2 minute read)
content: AI.com now redirects to x.AI, a company that aims to understand the true nature of the universe. OpenAI had seemingly purchased this domain back in February, but it looks like Musk has swooped in.

title: Should later stage startups consider an annual liquidity program? (2 minute read)
content: Liquidity puts capital into the hands of employees and early investors, enabling them to reinvest into the ecosystem or themselves. We still see very few secondary events in the startup world, but it looks like that might change, with all the new products and communities propping up to support private share sales.

title: The principles of great strategy (28 minute read)
content: A lot of people have a romantic view on strategy. You do this big lift, lock in a strategy, and then flip to pure execution. In reality, building a company is this dance between strategy and execution. Follow these principles to avoid writing a strategy doc that nobody ever looks at more than once.

title: Plaid: Finance’s Next Great Network (30 minute read)
content: A long deep dive into Plaid and how its product, model, and culture led it to become a FinTech giant.

title: Google’s Project IDX (2 minute read)
content: An AI-enabled browser-based development environment for building full-stack web and multiplatform apps

content: Mailbites simplifies email template development with ready-to-use components, sections, and layouts.

title: Raz (Product)
content: Collect deeper insights from your users with AI-powered forms that can ask follow-up questions.

title: The Race to Capture Value: Cloud Lessons for the AI Era (8 minute read)
content: We get it, AI is changing everything. But with any disruptive technology, doing the math on that disruption is actually pretty hard. Enter a16z with their typical deep-dive on how AI is going to disrupt the cloud and application layers. Dense (although good) read.

title: Maybe Coworking, self-storage, and e-mobility were never really “tech companies”? (2 minute read)
content: A zero interest-rate policy environment can drive a lot of things in the wrong direction. This article unpacks some ‘winner takes none’ outcomes, where even the best/surviving companies end up consuming a tremendous amount of dollars and delivering little value.

title: Real-world diversification (5 minute read)
content: As a big advocate of side-gigging and combinatorial creativity, I like this approach of using hobbies and extracurricular activities to build out T-shaped knowledge. What you do outside of work is going to influence how you show up to work.

title: Revolut says Latin America is a key region for growth (2 minute read)
content: The FinTech market in Latin America is growing rapidly, driven by increasing demand for online banking solutions, favorable demographics, and an underserved population. Revolut launched their operations in Brazil in May and they’re looking to Latam for their next stage of growth.

title: Sci-Fi idea bank (10 minute read)
content: Looking for your next startup? Ideas for new technologies almost always appear in sci-fi before they show up in real life.

title: Elon’s Neuralink raises $280 million (2 minute read)
content: Elon Musk-backed biotechnology company Neuralink announced a $280 million Series D funding round led by Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund.

title: Hesitation can kill great companies (4 minute read)
content: Delegating authority and fostering open communication allows organizations to tap into the collective wisdom of their workforce and overcome indecision.

title: Scaling talent through hypergrowth with Pierre Berlin (8 minute read)
content: Pierre Berlin, VP Sales at Figma, shares his insights on building and scaling GTM teams. It includes strategies for sequencing expansion, sourcing talent, hiring, and retaining top performers.

title: Beyond creativity, the three required variables of a good B2B brand marketing campaign (7 minute read)
content: Commitment, coverage, and stamina: the three required variables of effective brand building. You’ve gotta give your creative ideas time in the market to connect with an audience and understand the impact.

title: ChartPixel (Product)
content: ChartPixel turns your data into charts fully equipped with AI-assisted insights.

title: Disney’s Taylor Swift era (12 minute read)
content: It’s the relationship between low supply and high demand that creates valuable scarcity, and you simply can’t have that with a lot of digital goods where the supply is infinite. In-person events provide an opportunity to cultivate scarcity and deliver outsized money making.

title: From attention to intention, how content is changing (3 minute read)
content: Generative AI is significantly ramping up the volume of content being produced and put out to the world. This article explores how we attempt to keep humanity at the forefront by integrating in-person events and leaning into the individual over the institution.

title: Teach a Computer to Ghoti (2 minute read)
content: Quick read on why AI is on track to disrupt. A little cheeky too.

title: UK launches £1billion fintech fund to compete with Silicon Valley (3 minute read)
content: The UK has historically had a funding gap at the late stage. Large companies often shoot to the US to breach $500m values and IPO. The UK’s new fund, which is backed by Mastercard, Barclays, and the London Stock Exchange Group, aims to address the issue of fintech companies struggling to reach scale and pursue public listings.

title: Network Effects: The Evolution of Online Communities (13 minute read)
content: This article explores how online communities are going to amplify social network effects and how content, creators, and community all come together to build unique interactions and defensible companies.

title: Seizing the Moment: Strategies for Startups to Outmaneuver Competition in a Turning Economy (2 minute read)
content: Things are starting to thaw so it means startups that navigated cost-cutting over the last 3+ quarters are well-positioned to thrive.

title: Playbook to write better B2B content (7 minute read)
content: Writing gives unclear thoughts nowhere to hide. It’s a simple tool to bring clarity of thought to the challenges you’re facing. Inertia and perfection are the enemy - just get started.

title: Top 10 product management podcasts every PM should listen to (10 min read)
content: A curated list of podcasts - anyone building a product, managing product teams, or simply curious about product should absolutely tune in.

title: Fintech in AI: Five Lessons for Founders (2 minute read)
content: Quick-hitting post about a few things to consider around AI and Fintech. Always love Lightspeed’s take on things.

content: Essense transforms your online user feedback into actionable insights.

title: How to communicate when trust is low (8 minute read)
content: Whether it’s your partner, friend, colleague, or employee, it can be hard to communicate effectively when there’s low trust or you’re worried about conflict. Here’s a handful of tactics to start you in the right direction.

title: The State of Seed Investing w/ Jason Lemkin, Sam Lessin, Frank Rotman, and Harry Stebbings (60 minute audio)
content: With fundraising season approaching, this is a great listen about the state-of-the-state of seed investing with some of the folks that would know.

title: 11 Time Management Systems That Will Skyrocket Your Productivity (12 minute read)
content: As founders, you often get “productivity” thrown in your face, a lot. However, this list of frameworks, mental models, and rules keeps things simple and provides a nice reminder to constantly be working smart.

title: China is grappling with its lowest levels of foreign investment since 1998 (1 minute read)
content: China is looking to attract foreign investment after its recovery from Covid times has been slower than hoped.

title: OpenAI’s content moderation (5 minute read)
content: OpenAI proposes using GPT-4 for content policy development and content moderation decisions across digital platforms, taking the burden away from humans and allowing more consistent labeling of content and faster feedback loops. This begs the question, should AI be the authority on who can say what?

title: Fewer tech unicorns are being minted than at any point in the past decade (4 minute read)
content: Since 2018, over 250 unicorns have been made each year with the exception of 2021, when this number spiked to 787. 2023 may be the second exception to this average, we only saw 21 unicorns minted in Q1 2023.

title: PLG resources and insights (5 minute read)
content: A variety of resources on product-led growth and pithy insights on the art of scaled acquisition.

title: What the freemium (9 minute read)
content: Insights and guidance from Elena Verna, former CMO at Miro, on how and when to deploy freemium strategies at your tech company.

title: How to Get Your Startup's First 100 Users (3 minute read)
content: It never hurts to get a refresher course on the latest proven ways to get to those first 100 users of your solution. Manually reaching out (aka the hard way) is what always works best.

title: Insight IQ (Product)
content: Insight IQ takes your influencer marketing to the next level.

title: Consensus (Product)
content: Consensus is a search engine that uses AI to find insights in research papers.

title: Interview Hero (Product)
content: Interview Hero uses AI to write elegant summaries of your interviews.

title: Three Marketing Lessons from The Political Realm (10 minute read)
content: A deep dive into key marketing lessons presented with specific examples from the political realm. It’s a heavy but solid read.

title: Modern Meditations: Claire Hughes Johnson (17 minute read)
content: This interview with Claire Hughes Johnson, the former COO and now advisor of Stripe, unpacks her views on leadership, literature, and future technology.

title: Mobile point of sales systems and their impact on commerce (5 minute read)
content: Mobile point of sales systems (mPOS) mark a significant turning point in payment processing. Traditional point of sale systems are tethered to a location and oftentimes a little clunky. mPOS is distinctly more convenient, cheaper to set up and operate, and significantly more interoperable with your existing business operating systems. If you use in-person payments for your business, this is worth a read.

title: Why do investors care so much about LTV:CAC? (5 minute read)
content: Your CAC is a reflection of your sales and marketing spend to acquire a new user. The higher your LTV:CAC ratio, the more efficient that spending is. The more efficient it is, the more capital you’ll have to fund research and development to improve your product and continuously increase the LTV of your users. It’s a flywheel, and investors use this to directly value your company’s future potential.

title: Automating Creativity (6 minute read)
content: Wharton staged an idea-generation contest, pitting AI against a group of students. Human judges assessed idea quality. Of the 40 best ideas, 35 were created by ChatGPT. Oh boy. Thankfully, two other papers covered in this article mention that humans using AI tools can create even more powerful outcomes.

title: Securing AI (8 minute read)
content: The rush to AI is palpable and the inherent security challenges are of a complexity never seen before. As with every new technology, we need to think about how it's going to be weaponized WHILE it is hockey-sticking.

title: The Perils of Customer Selection (7 minute read)
content: Finding your first customers is a combination between intuition and strategy. Your customers dictate your trajectory. Great logos influence how others perceive you and they also dictate how you build your product and price it. If you choose the right customers early on (and they choose you!), it’ll act as a force multiplier to your success.

title: 12 Response Templates for Tricky Customer Service Emails (20 minute read)
content: Something something Pareto principle. How you efficiently handle tricky customers will enable you to spend more time on your best customers. Here’s a series of templates to tackle common customer escalations.

title: Canvas (Product)
content: Canvas connects all of your data so you can fully understand your startup.

title: Kypso (Product)
content: Ship better products using an AI copilot to manage and scale your team’s operations across everyday tools.

title: Layoff lessons: Four things I wish I knew (11 minute read)
content: Layoffs involve making decisions between different versions of bad. There’s no scenario where someone isn’t unhappy. Ask hard questions to ensure you only make one round of layoffs and focus your energy on supporting and motivating the employees who will remain with the company.

title: How games typically get built (12 minute read)
content: As gaming gets increasingly more mainstream, and venture capital dollars flood to the space, should we think about building or joining a gaming startup? This article explores how building games stacks up against traditional software development. Hint: they’re pretty different.

title: YC’s Group Partners share their worst investor meetings (26 minute watch)
content: YC’s operating team shares stories from their time approaching investors back when they were founders themselves. I can’t help but feel that these behaviors simply wouldn’t fly these days.

title: Adyen saw $20 billion wiped off its value in a single day (2 minute read)
content: Adyen reported earnings that missed expectations, a first since it went public in 2018, causing investors to sell in droves.

title: Nvidia is insanely profitable (1 minute read)
content: Nvidia's revenue grew 88% in Q2 2023. Its operating costs have only increased by 15% in the last year.

title: Klarna announces huge growth in key European markets (2 minute read)
content: Klarna famously raised $800m in 2022 at an 85% lower valuation than a prior round. For a lot of the tech world, this was the confirmation of a turning point from the heights of 2021. We’re watching this comeback story closely.

title: Acquiring 5 million users without getting lucky (5 minute read)
content: A simple method to consistently have your short-form content go viral is to find quality content in a similar niche through TikTok top ads, remix it, and push forward the ones that do well based on data.

title: Use fundraising as a feedback loop (3 minute read)
content: If you’ve been through the fundraising gauntlet, you’ve probably heard, “Thanks, but this space just isn’t for us”. Often this is a proxy for the investor simply not being sold on you yet. Use this junction as an opportunity to ask specifically what terrible things about startups in this space the VC is trying to avoid and feed that into your deck for the next pitch.

title: To PLG or not to PLG (8 minute read)
content: Product-led growth means that your product has the ability to acquire, activate, engage, or monetize without human intervention. For B2B, it’s not a question of whether you should invest in product-led growth, but rather when and how. This article provides some useful frameworks to consider when setting out on this journey.

title: OpenCoPilot (GitHub Repo)
content: An open source AI copilot for your SaaS product.

title: Gamma (Product)
content: Gamma uses AI to generate working presentations, documents, and webpages in under a minute.

title: Bloc (Product)
content: Bloc is an AI chatbot that assists you with sales, customer support, and skimming through long content.

title: Management: “The trough of zero dopamine” (11 minute read)
content: It’s hard to know if you’re doing a good job as a manager. The feedback loops are either long or unclear. Being a good manager requires a completely different set of skills to what you’ve likely built before. This takes time, and you’ll need to get comfortable with making a lot of mistakes along the way.

title: The Cloud 100 Report by Forbes (3 minute read)
content: Forbes has released its eighth annual Cloud 100 list, ranking the world's top private cloud computing companies. This year's list reflects the impact of market contraction on the industry, with AI companies like OpenAI rising in prominence and traditional cloud leaders facing challenges.

title: Cloud Unit Economics (9 minute read)
content: Unit economics in SaaS involves understanding how customer acquisition and revenue impact a company's financials. It encompasses metrics like CAC payback period, LTV-to-CAC ratio, and expansion potential, which are crucial for assessing profitability and guiding growth strategies in SaaS businesses.

title: Wellbeing at work is about feeling connected (3 minute read)
content: Whether hybrid, remote, or fully in-office, the leading indicator of performance and reduced instances of burnout is how connected an employee feels to the broader organization. This involves more access to information and resources, time to do work, and feedback from peers and managers.

title: Klaviyo files for an IPO (2 minute read)
content: At almost $600m ARR, still growing at 57% YoY, and profitable for the last 6 months, could Klaviyo be the first SaaS IPO out of the pandemic gates that sets the path for others?

title: Instacart Files For An IPO (2 minute read)
content: Grocery delivery giant Instacart has filed to go public in what is the first significant venture-backed tech IPO since December 2021.

title: Embracing failure (2 minute read)
content: Founders are increasingly being more open with their failures, and that’s a good thing. It shows that building startups and pursuing innovation is all about experimenting and taking shots on goal. Failures aren’t failures, simply attempts.

title: You need a co-founder (4 minute read)
content: Although there’s been some successful solo founders, you’ll often hear that you need a co-founder in a complimentary domain in order to build a truly great startup. But what is a co-founder? It’s really just a title, someone you trust to run the company in your absence. It doesn’t need to be someone with equal equity as you.

title: The Engineering executive’s role in hiring (24 minute read)
content: A comprehensive dive into the components of an effective hiring process for technical roles. Build a scalable system, train your hiring managers, set benchmarks and reporting windows with your recruiting team, and determine compensation levels before you kick off the hiring process.

title: Poozle (GitHub Repo)
content: Poozle is an open-source single API for Product Integrations.

title: Dicer (Product)
content: Dicer is a digital marketer providing the insights you need to make more money.

title: Mine My Reviews (Product)
content: Mine My Reviews uses AI to glean insights from your customer’s reviews and testimonials.

title: Around the world in 21 days (2 minute read)
content: Our expectations of how people use technology and the reality of that usage can often be different. Stay close to your users.

title: How to get someone on your podcast (2 minute read)
content: Make it as easy as humanly possible for them to say yes, schedule, do the prep, and show up.

title: Is reporting cash-on-hand to your investors now a red flag? (4 minute read)
content: Over the last 18 months, a lot of my personal portfolio companies started to put their cash-on-hand status right at the top of their investor update. It showed that month-month they were being cautious with cash, but it also often meant they weren’t really growing all that much. As the macro improved a little, is now the time to start deploying capital to build value?

title: Amazon acquires YC startup Fig (3 minute)
content: Fig has raised $2m in venture dollars from YC, General Catalyst, and a host of angel investors. It’s unlikely Amazon broke the bank making this acquisition, but it’s interesting to see another AI company get acquired so early on in its journey by a larger company.

title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT for enterprise (2 minute read)
content: OpenAI has launched a corporate version of ChatGPT with added features and privacy safeguards called ChatGPT Enterprise.

title: A breakdown of Instacart following its IPO filing (4 minute read)
content: On Monday, we flagged that Instacart had filed for an IPO. Here’s a quick look into the revenue of the business and how ads stack up against ordering.

title: Why B2B's Should Offer a Startup Discount Program (12 minute read)
content: Discounted programs can be an effective way of acquiring startup customers early in their journey at low costs. Startups ultimately become the enterprises of tomorrow. The hope is that as they scale, their usage of your product scales also. This article debunks some of the reservations you might have in your mind about discounted startup programs.

title: Building A Culture Of Excellence (90 minute audio)
content: An interview with David Singleton, the CTO of Stripe, in which he covers hiring tactics, how to build a product-oriented engineering team, strategies for maintaining developer productivity at scale, how AI is changing how engineers work, and more.

title: When to hire your first PM (11 minute read)
content: Don’t be tempted to hire a product manager before $1m ARR. PMs don’t write code or sell the product - they help to make good decisions. You need resources and activity for a PM to create the most impact, and you likely won’t have that at the earliest stages.

title: AskMore (Product)
content: AskMore uses AI to conduct user interviews that run without you.

title: Swifto (Product)
content: Swifto uses AI to automate your site’s A/B testing.

title: Pipio (Product)
content: Easily create videos in minutes with your own on-demand digital actors.

title: A guide to embedded payments with Maximilian Lehmann (15 minute read)
content: Traditionally only banks and fintech companies could distribute payments, but companies like Lightspeed, Toast, and Shopify are changing the game. We’re in the early innings of potential with embedded finance. If you’re a SaaS platform now, you can embed and monetize payments out of the gates.

title: The relationship between a VP of Sales and a VP of Marketing (2 minute read)
content: Marketing’s job is to make sales easier. You can only do this with an effective working relationship between the leaders of each function. When hiring for either role, simple questions allow you to test their opinions of the other function and get a window into their thinking and future potential.

title: The Traditional Funding Cycle Doesn't Work for Climate Tech (5 minute read)
content: Venture investment has been developed around companies that have predictable stages and timelines for growth. Raise your Seed when you’re at X level, move onto Series A at Y. For climate tech, these rules simply don’t apply. They have long R&D periods and often require a fair amount of capital before they can flip the monetization switch.

title: Are Collaboration Tools Overwhelming Your Team? (9 minute read)
content: Collaboration technology overload can drown employees in choices, leaving them feeling helpless. The irony is that by constraining those choices, adding frustrating obstacles to adopting yet another collaboration technology, and taking control away from individuals, employees can feel more in control of their work.

title: Visa and Mastercard and reportedly increasing card fees (2 minute read)
content: These changes would increase the interchange fees merchants need to pay when a consumer or business uses a card to make a purchase. For low margin businesses, this is a big deal.

title: SaaS IPO Window Inflection (5 minute read)
content: In honor of Klaviyo’s recent IPO filing, the first SaaS IPO in almost two years, here’s an interesting breakdown on the shared characteristics of companies that previously opened dormant SaaS IPO windows.

title: Measuring developer productivity? A response to McKinsey (18 minute read)
content: This is the first  of a two part series from Gergely that explores a response to McKinsey’s recent “solution” to measuring developer productivity at your organization. We’ll link part two in our next addition.

title: The three phases of the CEO (2 minute read)
content: As a CEO, you quickly evolve from building a product and managing a company to managing people. This shift from building a product to focusing on sales and then hiring and scaling your team requires you to evolve how you govern your time and inputs.

title: Reminder, you don’t work for your calendar (2 minute read)
content: Your calendar shouldn’t be a diary of someone else’s agenda. Audit your calendar on a regular basis and map out what gives you energy and what takes it away. Constantly prune meetings that do the latter.

title: Team GPT (Product)
content: Add AI to your team and collaborate in ChatGPT.

title: Kula (Product)
content: Your AI assistant to hire top talent.

title: Cannoli (Product)
content: Transform your Figma designs into HTML.

title: Navigating Market Downturns and Other Startup Advice with Melanie Naranjo (9 minute read)
content: This discussion dives into the importance of working at a company where everyone is equally passionate about doing great work and where the value of the People function is recognized. Culture is less about pizza parties and more about being bought into collective success.

title: The internet demands greatness (9 minute read)
content: The internet is loud and chaotic. An individual’s attention is being pulled in more directions than any generation before us. To stand out and win that attention, you increasingly need to be exceptional.

title: McKinsey Digital’s guide to digital excellence (13 minute read)
content: What separates top-performing teams from those that are just starting out? Well, McKinsey breaks it down into a four-step process that sees a would-be rockstar set the foundations of their culture, organize teams around user needs, invest in appropriate technology to support their operations, and empower teams to be autonomous.

title: OpenAI is making money (1 minute read)
content: OpenAI is on track to generate more than $1 billion in revenue over the next 12 months

title: Open-banking popularity in the UK (1 minute read)
content: Adoption of open banking payments reached a record high in July, climbing 102% YoY. Most of the use cases still center around account top-ups and card payments. If you’re a fintech in Europe, perhaps it's time to think about open banking?

title: MoonPay launched a venture arm (2 minute read)
content: The investment arm, dubbed MoonPay Ventures, will mainly invest between $100,000 to $1 million, targeting seed and Series A rounds.

title: RTO that employees actually like (2 minute read)
content: This company mandated in-office attendance on Tuesdays through Thursdays every alternate week, totaling six days per month. Employees could live anywhere, but they were responsible for their own commuting costs. It made critical planning like strategy and training easier.

title: Your Customers Hate MVPs. Make A SLC Instead (7 minute read)
content: It’s often advised that startups build minimum viable products (MVP), but MVPs come with the problem of not being very useful to your customers. So consider building simple, loveable, and complete (SLC) products instead.

title: The Evolution Of Miro’s User Onboarding (10 minute read)
content: A deep dive into how Miro’s user onboarding strategies changed throughout the startup, hyper-growth, and growth at scale stages.

title: Google’s Duet AI (1 minute read)
content: Make spreadsheets, whip up slide decks, and summarize all those documents you were never going to actually read.

title: Keplar (Product)
content: Unleash brand growth with next-gen simulated customers.

title: Seona (Product)
content: Seona is an AI assistant designed to optimize your SEO.

title: Measuring Developer Productivity? A Response To McKinsey, Part 2 (12 minute read)
content: As promised last Friday, here is the second part of Gergley’s response to McKinsey’s recent “solution” to measuring developer productivity at your organization.

title: Are people generous when the stakes are high? (20 minute read)
content: This is a fascinating long read. A study gave $10,000 to 200 participants with no strings attached to see what they’d do next. On average, participants spent over $6,400 on purchases that benefited others, including nearly $1,700 in donations to charity. Humanity has hope.

title: Inside Etsy’s Product, Growth, And Marketplace Evolution (72 minute audio)
content: A conversation on how Etsy capitalized on the pandemic e-commerce boom, how to optimize conversions, and how to navigate corporate culture shifts.

title: The Evolution of Open Source Business Models (4 minute read)
content: Tomasz is at it again giving a great overview of the ever-changing open source business models and that will continue to evolve with AI now in the picture. There are so many opportunities out there right now to adopt these models for new businesses. It’s a long play but clearly a good one.

title: Arm Seeks $52B Valuation For IPO (3 minute read)
content: Arm on Tuesday submitted an updated filing for its upcoming blockbuster initial public offering on the Nasdaq stock exchange, setting a price range between $47 and $51, which could value the company up to $52B.

title: Changing Landscape of Retail (3 minute read)
content: It’s true that the retail landscape is ever-changing and Gotham Gal always has an interesting perspective on these things. If you’re thinking at all about retail in this day and age, there are a bunch of variables that are coming to bear that need to be thought through.

title: Confidence vs. Arrogance (4 minute read)
content: Don’t confuse confidence with arrogance. A quick level-set on the difference for a few specific examples. Never hurts to check in with yourself.

title: The Top 5 Questions Every CEO Wrestles With - Lessons from Dave Kellogg (12 minute read)
content: Long read but full of lots of great tidbits from working with those that bring energy to managing your board and expectations. Always a great read coming off a holiday weekend (here in the US).

title: From Corporate Job to Solopreneurship – Insights From Building My Mentorship Business (18 minute read)
content: An exhaustive read about moving from a corporate job to spinning up your own gig from Marian Kamenistak. If you’re thinking of going it alone, there are some really solid tidbits in here.

title: Papermark (Product)
content: The Open-Source Docsend Alternative to securely share documents with real-time analytics.

title: Snipo (Product)
content: A side-by-side AI notetaker for your videos.

title: Rephrase AI (Product)
content: A text-to-video generation platform that eliminates the complexity of video production, enabling you to create professional-looking videos with a digital avatar in minutes.

title: Startups Need Both Profound Beliefs and Customer Input (6 minute read)
content: Steve Blank has always had great feedback on building companies and products and his recent return to regular writing again has been welcomed by many (us included). Having a profound belief is critical when thinking through customer input. Must read if you’re building a nascent product.

title: Dear SaaStr: When Should The CEO Step Away from Sales? (2 minute read)
content: Quick one on when to step out and more importantly how to gauge if you’re doing it right. I’ve always been a fan of being in LOTS of customer meetings.

title: Unpacking Instacart’s IPO (12 minute read)
content: This is a deep, deep dive into Instacart’s IPO and such a great lens on not only how it built its business but also on finding a way to IPO in this kind of market. It’s never the “perfect” time to IPO and reading the tea leaves on when to do it is nearly impossible.

title: Let’s Get Personal: Why AI Will Unlock a Massive Market for Online Consumer Services (4 minute read)
content: The idea of personalized services beyond what we have around shopping is really interesting and a16z agrees. In this post, a16z breaks down the opportunities and some of the companies already playing in this space.

title: The Rise of Data Lakes in Software Architecture (3 minute read)
content: The term “fracking of user data” is one that resonates even if the term fracking has negative connotations. The opportunities around unstructured data and LLMs as it relates to existing structured systems like databases are seriously limitless and we’re only just now starting to see the opportunities.

title: A New “Golden Age” For Alternative Lending (7 minute read)
content: Despite economic challenges and a shift in the lending landscape due to rising interest rates and inflation, we might be coming to a new era for alternative lending thanks to five catalysts: the return of affordable capital, the competitive advantage of alternative lenders in attracting new borrowers, streamlined operations, trust in risk models, and the potential for market share growth.

title: An Inside Look at Figma’s Unique GTM Motion (1 hour 30 minute podcast)
content: Figma has been a massive success and a lot of it can be credited to its early bottoms-up GTM strategy. This interview is with its 10th employee, the person responsible for that strategy. Great listen.

title: Onboarding Executives (3 minute read)
content: This article walks through some of the things to consider as you’re onboarding an executive. While these may seem obvious, in the rough-and-tumble world of daily startup life, they can get lost in the shuffle. Always a good refresher.

title: 10 Essential Steps Toward Building A Digital PR Strategy (15 minute read)
content: A complete guide to boosting your digital brand awareness online, with methods including defining your audience, researching and building your list of journalists, and monitoring coverage.

title: HelpKit AI (Product)
content: HelpKit AI turns your Notion knowledge base into a smart 24/7 AI assistant that provides precise and instant answers for your users.

title: AudioNotes (Product)
content: Convert your random voice notes and unstructured text notes into structured text summaries using AI.

title: Merlin (Product)
